English approximation: cat in British English, only approx. in American English
like cat, but further down to the uvula (uvular).

Scots loch,
 Spanish jota,
 German Bach

The pause in uh-oh!; 
 Cockney butter; glottal stop

Arabic letter/symbol: Means that the following syllable is stressed: /ˈʕarabiː/ عربي ('Arab').
Means that the preceding vowel is long
A geminated consonant never belongs to one syllable and is often broken with a stress.
